image.altText: Mark Carney standing behind a podium delivering a speech in front of the Canadian flag

props.synopsis: For months, senior officials have been discussing exporting Australia's world-leading JORN radar technology to the United States, but after Donald Trump's return to the White House, Canada saw an opportunity and leapt.

title.children: Australia's 'biggest defence export' was meant for the US first, but Canada snuck past Trump

image.altText: Astronauts landing

props.synopsis: NASA'S SpaceX Crew-9, including astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, are safely back on Earth this morning after a long-awaited journey home. Follow live.

title.children: NASA's 'stranded' astronauts safely back home after nine months in space

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore breathe fresh air for first time in nine months
Nick Hague is the first astronaut to be wheeled out of the capsule

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, waring a suit and tie and making a hand gesture, pictured in front of a blue background

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin rejects Donald Trump's proposal for an immediate full ceasefire in Ukraine, but tells the US president he will pause attacks on energy infrastructure while talks on a permanent truce take place.

title.children: Putin agrees to halt energy infrastructure strikes, tells Trump to end Ukraine aid

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission has found the man who led the Board of Inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann engaged in "serious corrupt conduct".

title.children: 'Serious corrupt conduct': Findings from inquiry into Walter Sofronoff released

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses, a black shirt and pants walks next to two men in a suit, with one holding a microphone up to him.

props.synopsis: Ahmad Rashad Nadir, 27 and Sarah Abu Lebdeh, 26, were charged over a video where they allegedly made threats to Israeli patients.

title.children: Sydney nurse shielded by men in hoodies leaving first court appearance

props.synopsis: Once as high as 60 cents per kilowatt hour, solar feed-in tariffs are now as low as just a few cents for some. While 4 million households have rooftop solar, home battery storage systems sit at around 320,000 — but take-up has surged as the economics improve.

title.children: 'It's a scam': As solar feed-in tariffs plunge, battery demand surges

image.altText: Adam Bandt in Mural Hall

props.synopsis: As you would expect in the nation's current cheesed-off state of mind, all three major party leaders enjoyed sub-zero popularity among survey respondents. Everyone hates everything right now, especially if it's anywhere near politics. But it was surprising news for the Greens leader.

title.children: Sub-zero popularity aside, many voters don't even recognise this leader

image.altText: A white-haired man wearing a suit looks sideways

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu says the fighting will continue until his country achieves its goals of destroying Hamas and freeing all hostages held by the militant group.

title.children: Israeli PM vows to destroy Hamas after resuming air strikes in Gaza

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking, with another man out of focus behind him.

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor has denied that a proposal to hold a referendum to hand politicians unconstrained power to deport criminal dual-citizens is Coalition policy. Follow live.

title.children: Deportation referendum 'not Coalition policy', Angus Taylor says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Radar deal with Canada will be 'significant if finalised': PM
Exclusive: Australia's 'biggest defence export' was meant to go to the US first
'Nobody's talking about this here': Braddon Lib candidate says of deportation referendum

image.altText: A pencil holder of coloured pencils sits in front of pieces of paper with childrens' finger paintings.

props.synopsis: As the public outcry from educators and parents intensifies in the wake of the Four Corners investigation into Australia's broken childcare system, the reluctance of senior politicians responsible for overseeing the sector to do something to fix it is striking.

title.children: Albanese's response to broken childcare system epitomises a serious flaw

image.altText: A close-up of a woman's hands, with fingernails painted blue, pink and white.

props.synopsis: Carly loved dressing as a girl from an early age and was preparing to start puberty blockers when the Queensland government banned her and hundreds of others from receiving free treatment. Her mother is furious at politicians for "interfering" in Carly's healthcare.

title.children: Mum of trans teen has 'had enough' of political meddling in healthcare

image.altText: A little girl on the beach wearing a cap and pink top

props.synopsis: The NT coroner is examining a toddler's "undetermined" cause of death after a medical incident at a childcare centre in Darwin's rural area, about 18 months after she was found unresponsive by staff.

title.children: Toddler's death after childcare medical incident examined by coroner

image.altText: Two signes outside a shop that read "MYER"

props.synopsis: Myer's profit dropped nearly 40 per cent in the first half of the financial year. A fall on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks lower, as investors exercise caution ahead of a monetary policy decision from the Federal Reserve. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Myer profit tumbles as department store hit by distribution issues

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Treasury Wine could benefit from potential Trump tariffs on wine: Morgan Stanley
WiseTech releases findings on Richard White's conduct

image.altText: A middle aged woman with brown hair sitting at a table with a small dog

props.synopsis: As data shows thousands of over-65s are winding up in hospital with oral health issues, the Australian Dental Association is calling for a scheme that gives seniors access to free dental work.

title.children: Dentists want a free oral health plan for seniors as hospitalisations surge

image.altText: A woman is standing lon the left wearing a singlet and denim shorts. Next to her are her two children and her partner

props.synopsis: On a hot Autumn's day, parents in the regional town of Inverell sent their children to the local pool to cool off. Not long after, NSW Police told them to leave.

title.children: 'Discrimination': Parents outraged as kids removed from local pool

image.altText: Peter Dutton wearing suit sitting at coffee shop with Jacinta Price in blazer next to him

props.synopsis: The ABC's conversations with almost a dozen senior Coalition figures have revealed widespread frustration and confusion about a referendum some say will take focus away from the cost of living.

title.children: Dutton's 'insane' proposal for referendum leaves some Liberals fuming

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A young man in a white polo shirt smiles in a radio studio

props.synopsis: Adelaide United defender Josh Cavallo, the first openly gay professional footballer, says he still receives daily death threats since coming out more than three years ago.

title.children: A-League player reveals daily death threats since coming out as gay

image.altText: A close up photo of Prince Harry's face

props.synopsis: More than 80 pages of court filings and transcripts were released with large sections heavily redacted.

title.children: Prince Harry's US visa application followed 'applicable rules and regulations'

image.altText: A boy in a pink short with his arm around another boy in a dark jacket.

props.synopsis: Emergency service crews were called to John Renshaw Drive at Black Hill, north-west of Newcastle, where a Holden Commodore and a Ford utility had collided.

title.children: L-plater who had just picked up his first car dies in horror crash

image.altText: A shot of several half-built homes.

props.synopsis: The federal opposition is being pressed for more detail on one of its key housing projects, with both Labor and some housing economists questioning whether it can meet its ambitions.

title.children: Coalition pressed for detail on key housing pledge

image.altText: Jase Shore in a green cap and white shirt with neck tattoos

props.synopsis: After hearing "anguished" yells from members of the public in Sydney's CBD in 2019, these men raced to apprehend a man on a stabbing rampage.

title.children: Heroes who pinned Sydney murderer with milk crate given bravery award

image.altText: Pokies

props.synopsis: The state government is being urged to fast-track pokies carded play, used at Crown Casino, to all of Victoria's poker machine venues.

title.children: A trial to curb pokies losses set to roll out in Victoria — not everyone's happy

image.altText: Woman and man smiling in a selfie in front of the ocean.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright was camping at one of Victoria's most popular national parks when he was bitten by a tiger snake. More than two months later he hasn't fully recovered.

title.children: Within minutes of being bitten by a snake, Matt was struggling to breathe

image.altText: Aerial shot of big gas plant on the red rocks of the Burrup in the Pilbara

props.synopsis: The opposition leader would move to facilitate approval for the WA gas expansion within 30 days, and crack down on appeals against approval decisions.

title.children: Dutton vows fast-track approval for Woodside's gas behemoth

image.altText: A young Palestinian man inspecting a bombed out room with buildings visible behind him.

props.synopsis: While the US has stated it supports Israel's next steps, European and Middle Eastern governments are warning the renewed strikes risk undermining regional stability.

title.children: 'Dangerous escalation': World leaders react to Israeli strikes on Gaza

image.altText: A crowd fills a town hall for a protest meeting.

props.synopsis: One north-east Victorian town is battling a renewable energy project while its neighbour has plans to go totally green, fuelling policy division ahead of the election.

title.children: Victorian town pledges to take fight against battery storage to election

image.altText: Cathrine Mupangure takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Growing up as a neurotypical woman of colour in a white country, there is not a lot of wiggle room to be different. Having a disability makes that 10 times harder.

title.children: I was seen as lazy growing up. My ADHD diagnosis explained a lot

image.altText: Thomas Bach, a grey-haired man, wearing a suit and looking serious.

props.synopsis: Whoever replaces Thomas Bach as the new president of the International Olympic Committee will have untold riches, but will also be tasked with solving some of sport's great challenges.

title.children: Multiple challenges facing Bach's heir, the most powerful person in sport

image.altText: A man in a colourful shirt and black sunglasses kneels down in red sand

props.synopsis: The discovery of these skeletal remains rewrote Australia's history books. Decades later, they're at the centre of a court battle.

title.children: Reburials underway amid court challenge over thousands-year-old skeletons

image.altText: A white mother, brown hair, pink top with her young daughter sitting on her lap on the floor of a kids playroom.

props.synopsis: Parents of children with disabilities and complex medical needs have raised concerns about the quality of care provided at a Northern Territory special school due to a lack of staffing. The government says it will look into increasing staff at the school.

title.children: 'She could lose her life': NT parents raise alarm about specialist school

image.altText: Flooding under a bridge in Townsville.

props.synopsis: The Bruce Highway in north Queensland has been cut once again after a tropical low dumped more than 200mm of rain on parts of the region overnight.

title.children: Flooding rains cut Bruce Highway as north Qld cops pre-dawn drenching

image.altText: A close of a woman's mouth as she eats a donut with pink frosting, sprinkles and a rainbow-coloured lolly on it.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO says the average Australian's diet is likely to get worse within five years, hurting our health and the taxpayers' purse. So what is standing in the way of better eating?

title.children: Australia's junk food problem is set to get worse. How do we fix it?

image.altText: A painting of a dog with long white fur and what appears to be human eyes and lips.

props.synopsis: Medieval animal illustrations have popped up all over the internet. Why do they capture our imagination?

title.children: Why are pictures of medieval animals so strange? Historians explain

props.synopsis: Married at First Sight is the highest rating show on Australian television — but its toxic relationships are increasingly being called into question. Why are so many Australians are drawn to the show?

title.children: Is Married at First Sight too toxic for TV?
